intro: Viola tricolor var. syrtica, commonly known as the Syrtic violet, is a variant of the common violet that exhibits distinct botanical characteristics. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region, particularly found in rocky and dry habitats. The plant features trifoliate leaves with heart-shaped lobes and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of violet, blue, and white. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 cm and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun to partial shade. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and adaptability to various garden conditions.
